intro: Diplomorpha virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery, velvety leaves and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Diplomorpha virgata is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh, coastal environments.
